timeline.message: Created model package, moved ChangeFeedOptions to implementation package
Moved compositePath to model package
Moved CosmosAsyncContainerResponse, properties, and more files to model
Moved Cosmos Async Item Response to model
Moved permission response and  properties
Moved Cosmos Async Stored Procedure Response
Moved Cosmos Async Trigger Response
Moved UserDefined Async Response
Moved Cosmos Async User Response to model
Moved other Cosmos Response types to model package
Moved all request option classes to model package
Moved Database Account and Database Account Location to model
Fixed constructor accessor
Moved FeedOptions and FeedResponse to model package
Moved feed response to model
Moved triggers, indexes, sql params, unique keys to model package
Moved partition key, partition key definition, and other options
Moved Resource, JsonSerializable, and cosmos error to model package

timeline.bodyText: why FeedResponse is a model but pageFlux is not?
timeline.author: moderakh

timeline.bodyText: FeedResponse was moved to model, why CosmosPageFlux is not a model?
timeline.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: Yes, these should be model too. I will move both CosmosPagedFlux and CosmosPagedIterable to model.
replies.author: kushagraThapar

timeline.bodyText: question: ThrottingRetryOption is not a rest contract. it defines client behaviour on throttling. Is this qualify for a model?
timeline.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: No it doesn't, as it specifies client configuration.
replies.author: kushagraThapar

timeline.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: I was not sure about this one. But since CosmosResponseDiagnostics is not a model too, so I agree, this shouldn't be either. Will move this back to cosmos package.
replies.author: kushagraThapar

timeline.bodyText: I am not sure if this is a model. as it specifies client behaviour not over wire contract
timeline.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: Agreed, as it specifies client behavior, will move it back.
replies.author: kushagraThapar

timeline.bodyText: why do we need the setMapper?
timeline.author: moderakh

replies.author: kushagraThapar

replies.bodyText: I checked again, and this constructor is not used at all, I will see if we can remove this constructor and hence setMapper can be removed as well.
replies.author: kushagraThapar

timeline.bodyText:
can you move instantiateJsonSerializable to model package?
If you do that then you don't have to do setAccessible()
timeline.author: moderakh

timeline.bodyText: same here. if instantiateJsonSerializable is moved to model package, setAccessable should be required.
timeline.author: moderakh

timeline.message: Moved feed response diagnostics and throttling retry options back to cosmos. Moved CosmosPagedFlux and CosmosPagedIterable to model

timeline.bodyText:
I am not sure if CosmosPageFlux is a model or not.
From one perspective  using CosmosPageFlux internally will issue IO request to fetch more results, so it shouldn't be a model.
from another perspective, other query result classes are model, so one may say this one is a model too.
Can we check what some other services are doing? is any other service sdk using pageflux?
timeline.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: Sure, to be consistent with other azure SDKs, I reverted the change and moved both CosmosPagedFlux and CosmosPagedIterable back to cosmos package.
replies.author: kushagraThapar

timeline.message: Moved CosmosPagedFlux and CosmosPagedIterable to cosmos package
